Description: Eternal rage is a good rage. Barbarians have a couple of routes they can choose to follow. Way of the totem allows you choose an animal that you can share strength with. You turn into a half were-creature with that animal, calling upon it during your rage, imbuing your body with the totem's power. Next is the way of the berserker. The lower your health, the harder you hit. It's risky but could be worth the risk of your life.

Who needs armor when you have gauntlets? Brawlers need no armor as their fists are enough. Strong as any blade and often more reliable than any forged steel. The brawler specializes in hand to hand combat, throwing punches while up close and personal. They can attack more often than other classes, landing 2 hits per AP while other classes can only land 1.

Evil, undead, sickly creatures, all must be rid. Crusaders spend their time making sure that the world is cured from the sickness known as corruption. Wielding a white book or two known as Celestia, they are able to deal great amounts of damage to dark tainted creatures, such as undead. At half health, they regain all of their mana in a burst of energy.

Stand as a fortress, lead and protect those around you. Three codes allow for a variaty of playstyles. Code of the Warlord required leadership and command, providing your group with tactics and strategy. Code of the Juggernaught requires great bravery as you meet the enemy face to face, using both offence and defence, trying to keep the heat off of your team. Lastly, Code of the Fortress, you do as the name might imply, you taunt the enemy and stand as an unbreakable fortress, protecting those close to you at all costs.

Stand for your order or go down in it's name. Each knight has an order, a mindset and group they follow and devote themselves towards. You know stances to enhance your fighting and a unique boon from your order. Each order has it's own boons and flavor. Maybe you'll be a Crow Knight who serves death and tends the graves. Maybe Iron, who believe their strength to be the pinnacle. Or maybe Rosehelm who devote themselves to chivalry and charisma. If you want a different order, simply ask and we have more.

Bow and arrow, crossbow or gun in hand, ammo at the ready! With three paths to choose, you are sure to find your fit. Scouts can shoot while moving, allowing you to get out of cover, shoot and return in one turn. Snipers like to deal damage and take out specific weaknesses in the enemies they fight. Projectile marksmen love to create odd amunition to shoot from their weapons, from elemental arrows to a clutch of marbles.

Rangers roam, but don't take the roaming to mean they are helpless. With three different creeds that they can devote themselves to, they have several ways to be played. Creed of rain love to make it rain with arrows, causing AOE attacks with the barrage of arrows. Creed of the hunt allows you something special, not only an animal companion but also having special abilities with your animal. Creed of the Blade allows you twin blades and an uncanny ability to be quite nimble with the blades.

Dagger, dagger, dagger... not enough dagger. Rogues, unlike in normal dnd, have the unique ability throw more knives than most enemies know what to do about. They can throw three daggers or four throwing knives in each hand every attack. They do get some sneaky abilities and are proficient in rooftop running. Always remember, a rogue can never have enough throwing weapons.

The Jailor, Justice and Jury. Wardens act as the jailors of the world, finding criminals and putting them where they belong, Jail. Some decide to take things into their own hands and they don't let the criminals get to their jail safe haven. Each warden has a different and unique style of fighting. Some use double hand axes, other use polearms almost more adeptly than acrobats. They are able to use all of the damage types with each weapon they specialize in, what that weapon is, is up to you.
If fireball were a mele attack

When words fail, music speaks. Bards have no lack of implements for their spell casting. Any instrument that they spend enough time with, can become their implement if they so desired it to be. They spend most of their training learning how to please the ear with the music they produce. Not only can it be pleasing to the ear but it can have a unique boon to the spells cast by the bard.

Spells or sword? Both, both is good. The battle mage is what happens when a warrior teaches a mage. Battle Mages can often tank hit and deal that damage right on back. They are one of the odd mage classes that fit half way between combat and magic classes. There's two kinds of Battlemage, one that focuses on Health and one that focuses on Mana. Health focused battlemages start with a D12 hit die and a D10 mana die.

Spells or sword? Both, both is good. The battle mage is what happens when a warrior teaches a mage. Battle Mages can often tank hit and deal that damage right on back. They are one of the odd mage classes that fit half way between combat and magic classes. There's two kinds of Battlemage, one that focuses on Health and one that focuses on Mana. Mana focused battlemages start with a D10 hit die and a D12 mana die.

Don't take my kindness for weakness. Clerics both heal and deal damage. They aren't the most hearty of the casters but that doesn't stop them from often throwing themselves in danger just to save their party members. Most will focus heavily on two main magic branches, Life and Celestia, the two white magic branches.

Healers are in the back, but far from unimportant. Less frequently known as white mages, Healers are specialized in books of Life, usually starting with the first two books. They spend their time tending and caring for those who can’t, oftentimes finding themselves beside clerics in abbeys, they find strength in praying to omuns for strength and guidance to heal their party members more. However, never take them for being helpless as they can employ a class specific spell called "Evoke".

A mage is only as good as their arsenal of spells. Adept at spellcasting, mages have spent their time learning from masters before them. Some chose to attend magic academies, while others may learn from a master or two. Either way, they earn books of worth, tomes that not only signify what they have accomplished, but also enable unique boons for the mage. Along with the books of worth, mages usually pick a pallet, a color of spellcasting that boosts certain abilities.

The dead can be used for good as well as evil, but this is for the betterment of the world. The medium is a spellcaster who's turned a dark page, and uses the Books of the Dead to help solve crimes, trying to do good by the world. These black mages are some of very few entrusted with such dangerous magics. Necromancy has proved to be a useful tool for these mages of the dark arts. They often make bone amalgams of non-humanoids that serve as their tools of choice.

A sword is as good as it's wielder, but it doesn't hurt to put a spell on it. Spellswords and Enchanters are one in the same, it just depends on where they place their spells. Enchanters tend to enchant and rune their armor. Spellswords on the other hand, enchant and rune their weapons. Both get a unique book that allows spells to become temporarily imbued into what they choose.

Having friends is useful, but summons and conjures are always there to back you up. Summoners can work in a few ways. Either they have formed a unique bond with each summon they possess or they managed to get their hands on a very rare Summons spell book. On the flip side, Conjurers summon constructions that they build from their own mana. Conjurers can imbue their contsructs with another spell to give the construct special effects.

A lost spell book is a sad spell book. Vigilant are adventurers who head out with one main purpose, find lost spell books and use them. They have usually made a deal with The Magician, the father of magic, to gather spell books that have been lost to time, or taken from his library mysteriously. Vigilants usually have a mentor that gives them a couple of lost spell books to begin with. With the training they receive and their deal with The Magician, they have a knack for finding more lost spell books than most adventuring parties.

Agile and nimble, the Acrobats are able to preform flashy moves to help them get around. If an acrobat has a polearm, they will be able to use it to jump around the combat field and even vault over the enemies, allowing for an easy flank. It might not be within the best interest of the acrobat to do that if there are a lot of enemies in the area though as they aren't the most hearty.

Stealing secrets from those on the every end of life. Much like a secret agent, Agents have an underground information network that they can almost always tap into. They are excellent at working under pressure and getting information from people. Though they don't really like combat, they are useful in gathering and relaying useful tactics. If you need to know something about someone, you go to an agent or gypsy. However, there's two sides to every coin. Where the Agents work with the higher of society, Gypsies work with the lower of society. They will use their charm to get information from beggars and lowly slicks. Much like Agents, they too have a network chain that they constantly tap into and will gain and feed information into.

Potions, elixirs and brews galore. Alchemists spend their time concocting brews for their party. With the right plants and components, an alchemist could even make basic explosives. Most of the time, they find themselves making simple healing and mana potions. For many alchemists, their time is spent foraging to find quality ingredients to make both familiar and new potions alike. Sometimes, new blends allow for stronger brews or even new potion effects altogether. So go out there and experiment around!

Guns aren't common but the artillerist gets some fun ones. There's two types of guns they can get. The heavy Cindercaster or the Light Cindercaster. Both have their pros and cons. A heavy Cindercaster can fire larger pellets that deal more individual damage but it does fire slower and their movement is slower while they have it out, due to the heavy weight. Light Cindercasters are smaller but fire quicker. Unlike with the heavy Cindercaster, movement is unrestricted while this one is out.

Rooftop runs and hidden blades. These assassins are like those from Assassins Creed. A set of hidden blades are awarded to each assassin as part of their training. Hidden blades hide on the forearm under the sleeves of the wearer and can pop out towards the hands with a flick of the wrists, allowing for some interesting assassination style kills. Stealth is their friend and if you need a scout, an assassin is your best bet.

Roll the fists and let the blows fall. Monks are the upfront fighters, making their fists fly and using Ki to allow them to deal additional blows to their opponent. They can also use their Ki to do super human stunts such as jump a two story building in one bound or run at twice their usual speed. They will spend a good amount of time looking for scrolls of knowledge, known as palms, that give more unique abilities and attacks for the monk.

Another life, another world, but yet, so little memories. Outworlders are usually normal people from other worlds that died in their worlds and showed up in this one. They don’t usually don’t have any memories or much gear on them. They will begin with a memento from their world though, something they had on them when they died. As for the world they came from, well, the possibilities are endless. You'll begin with an extra feat.

No class? Not a problem. Pilgrims are what happens when an adventurer just doesn't know what class they want to take on. While most other classes think them weak, they have the most potential. Spending time with other classes in training and practical combat will allow the pilgrim to copy some skills from other classes allowing them to be a versatille tool for any situation.

I know exactly what this is, and I can tell you right now, this belongs in an archive! Adventurer Scholars are those who use knowledge to assist their comrades in all manner of ways, having the unique benefit of having both practical and intellectual knowledge of whatever knowledges they know. They may not be the best in combat or magic but they are brave and will go on perilous adventurers to ensure the preservation of history and knowledge.

Skill monkey is skill monkey. Trackers are the most skilled of any class, starting with the most skills of any. Trackers can do almost anything they can think of. Most are quite skilled tinkers, being able to come up with a design and then execute it near flawlessly compared to what they saw in their mind.

The Occultist is a hunter of the mythical, monsters and cults. They are one of the few regarded in a similar fashion to the Witch Hunters. They are a collection of 10 Familial clans that fight monsters, generation after generation, passing skills and knowledge down the line. Capable in all fields, these hunters are forced to master a 'jack of all trades' approach in order to route the evil in the world.

Stand for what you need, but be always on the move. The Sentinel, is a far cry from a stationary defender, rather, they utilize rapid movement and the reach of their polearms to exploit enemies weaknesses and gaps in their defenses. They use throwing weapons to feign attacks and create openings for themselves to punch hard hitting strikes through the toughest opponents. Sentinels have different combat styles named after the old draconids: Dragon, Wyvern, Drake, and Wurm. Each of these pertain to how to utilize their weapons and skills, being ritual casters as well as adept masters at improvised tactics they can easily overwhelm those unfamiliar with the nuances of combat.

No cult is good until it's destroyed. Witch Hunters are the only class that can use books of the black, a dark spell book that corrupts anyone who doesn't have the witch hunter's gift. They aren't corrupted by black magic and can use cursed items that would be dangerous for anyone else. If they hear about a cult, that cult had better look out, because that witch hunter will take them out.
They are a ki casting class. Think bender from Avatar the Last Airbender
Female only: Gypsy, Assassin, Ranger, Bard

Roll the fists and let the blows fall. Monks are the upfront fighters, making their fists fly and using Ki to allow them to deal additional blows to their opponent. They can also use their Ki to do super human stunts such as jump a two story building in one bound or run at twice their usual speed.
Assassin, Rogue, Agent, Acrobat
Ranger, cleric, healer, crusader
Masterless samuri- barbarian, spellsword, brawler, Tracker
Ki user who uses their ki to enhance items, much akin to enchanters
Knight, marksman, warden, battlemage
Alchemist, summoner, enchanter, Conjurer
Acrobat, pilgram, witch hunter, occultist
Summoner
Alchemist
Guardian, spellsword, Agent, Pilgram
Male only: Historian but more wizardly- Mage, Summoner, Vigilant, bard
